items.title: For Python 3.8 we need to up this to 1.1.0
Python 3.8 test error: AttributeError: 'Constant' object has no attribute 'n'
items.body:
This is Python 3.8.0a3. I had to modify the tox.ini to have basepython set for 3.8:

```patch
diff --git a/tox.ini b/tox.ini
index c81ac77..f40958d 100644
--- a/tox.ini
+++ b/tox.ini
@@ -1,6 +1,6 @@
 [tox]
 envlist =
-    py27,py33,py34,py35,py36,py37,pypy,
+    py27,py33,py34,py35,py36,py37,py38,pypy,
     docs,{py2,py3}-cover,coverage
 skip_missing_interpreters = True
 
@@ -14,6 +14,7 @@ basepython =
     py35: python3.5
     py36: python3.6
     py37: python3.7
+    py38: python3.8
     pypy: pypy
     py2: python2.7
     py3: python3.5
```


And when i run tox for 3.8 on master (333986c):

```
$ tox -e py38
GLOB sdist-make: .../pyramid_mako/setup.py
py38 inst-nodeps: .../pyramid_mako/.tox/.tmp/package/1/pyramid_mako-1.0.3.dev0.zip
```

items.title: bump Python version support
items.body: We need to bump Python version support in tox.ini, setup.py, and anywhere else so that the minimum version is 3.4 and up to 3.7, with an optional failure for 3.8.

items.title: Default overriding of "default_filters" is not mentioned in documentation.
items.body: Mako has a default for [default_filters](https://docs.makotemplates.org/en/latest/filtering.html#the-default-filters-argument) depending on a couple settings. It appears that *pyramid_mako* [overrides](https://github.com/Pylons/pyramid_mako/blob/917254f8ba01574b539652c30f8e695a7aeb254f/pyramid_mako/__init__.py#L189) Mako's *default_filters* setting to `['h']` (HTML escaping) when *mako.default_filters* is not explicitly set. This behavior does not appear to be documented in *pyramid_mako*'s [documentation](https://docs.pylonsproject.org/projects/pyramid-mako/en/latest/). I'm not objecting to this safe default but it was unexpected and documenting it would be beneficial.

items.title: Update the docs to match the new world order
items.body:
@stevepiercy 

What is required to update Sphinx so that it doesn't clone for the docs?

items.title: Allow configuring a custom TemplateLookup subclass
items.body:
Currently the only way to do this is to copy the entirety of `add_mako_renderer` and `includeme` and change the class name.

Which then breaks `pyramid_debugtoolbar` and who knows what else, because you end up with multiple renderers for `.mako`.

items.title: add link to ReadTheDocs on README.md
items.body:
add a link to [ http://pyramid-mako.readthedocs.org/en/latest/index.html ] on [README.md ] 

• the /docs directory isn't generated ( though it is readable )
• this should bump the search engine equity of the RTD , which barely made the first page when searching for 'pyramid_mako docs'

items.title: "template reload" doesn't seem to apply to 3rd party libraries.
items.body:
Originally from https://github.com/Pylons/pyramid/issues/1265

I think this might be the most appropriate forum.

External .mako files are not reloaded.  this includes custom debugtoolbar panels (which is a PAIN for making custom panels )

@bertjwregeer , i can confirm that `dbtmako.reload_templates = True` doesn't work.

the easiest representation would be to do this:
1. Enable an app to use the debugtoolbar
2. Hit a URL on the app, then bring up the debugtoolbar page.
3. Edit a .mako panel on the debugtoolbar 
4. reload the URL, note that nothing changes.

this also happens If:
   a- you have your own debugtoolbar panels installed as a separate package
   b- you install the debugtoolbar panels within your pyramid app

i think this has to do with how the debugtoolbar loads the mako files.  they don't appear on the disk cache , possibly they're in memory.

items.title: rev 16f8293 made make.imports not working
items.body:
Default aslist flatten is True, thus imports such as
from markupsafe import escape_silent

Will be converted to list ['from', 'markupsafe', 'import', 'escape_silent']

Suggest change imports = aslist(imports) to imports = aslist(imports, False)

items.title: Add `future_imports ` management as new configuration option
items.body:
Mako 0.8 introduced some ability to import features from `__future__`, through new parameter  `future_imports` to `mako.template.Template` and `mako.lookup.TemplateLookup` (http://docs.makotemplates.org/en/latest/usage.html#mako.template.Template.params.future_imports).
This specially allows use by default Unicode as strings literals, without prefixing them with `u`, which is (at time of this writing) unfeasible by a naive `<%! from __future__ import unicode_literals %>`.

Management of this feature could probably be achieved via a new configuration option, e.g. `mako.future_imports`, modeled from `mako.imports`.

items.title: pyramid.reload_templates setting does not work
items.body: While `pyramid.reload_templates = true` does not work, `mako.reload_templates = true` does work.

items.title: Testing of renderer relative paths
items.body: Renderer relative paths needs more testing in `pyramid_mako` before I cut a new release.

items.title: version 0.3 isn't backwards compatible
items.body: Upgrading from pyramid_mako 0.2 to 0.3 breaks pyramid 1.4.x apps with mako.directories settings.
